name: places/ChIJqScD_z_2wokRVoIObCnbUuM

displayName.text: New Residence Hall- Teachers College, Columbia University

formattedAddress: 517 W 121st St, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 517 W 121st St, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text:
Terrible experience staying here as a summer conference resident for 6 weeks. Rooms were not properly cleaned prior to check in with hair everywhere, even on the bathroom walls. The bathroom exhaust vent was not working and was sealed up by tape, apparently awaiting maintenance. As a result the bathroom was always humid and stuffy. The worst part was the leaking sink - water was CONSTANTLY seeping out of the sink and dripping to the floor. I had to put a towel around the sink to soak it up during the entire stay.

Request of extra towels were denied. There is a weekly linen exchange which turned out to be a huge frustration. Even though I have followed every instruction (leaving the dirty ones in the doorway on time and putting a clear label with my room number on it), they still managed to forget about giving me clean linens. Finally managed to get new ones after going down to the security booth and asking the security officer to contact the residential office (they close at 5pm). I suspect if I ask any later I would have to spend the night with no linens/towels.

Staff were generally polite and responded promptly to emails, except for the front desk security. I once left my residence pass in my room and had to ask the security to let me in. He was very impatient and insisted that I pull off my mask when I speak, saying that he can't hear me with my mask on, even though I was literally shouting. He then insisted that I give him a UNI, which I told him repeatedly that I don't have one as I am not a Columbia/TC student.

Overall, I am extremely disappointed with my stay here and would not recommend it to anyone.

originalText.text: The staff is awful. No one has any agency and must refer to a handbook for every answer. Talk about bureaucracy

originalText.text: newly renovated, but lost all the charm, such a pity
